{"step_by_step_thinking": "To determine if the prognosis of patients with allergic contact dermatitis is dependent on the omnipresence of the allergen, we need to analyze the relevant documents. Document [0] provides information on the prognosis of occupational contact dermatitis among patients allergic to rubber chemicals and latex (ubiquitous allergens) and epoxy (nonubiquitous allergen). It states that overall, 22% of patients with allergy to a nonubiquitous allergen had total clearance of eczema compared with 10% of cases allergic to ubiquitous allergens. This suggests that the prognosis may be dependent on the omnipresence of the allergen. However, other documents may provide additional insights. Let's review them.", "answer_choice": "A/B/C"}
